pull.title: fix locking issue with new mempool limiting
pull.body:
Current master crashes on OSX with an exception: "boost: mutex lock failed in pthread_mutex_lock: Invalid argument".

`mempool` is a global object and gets initialized over `cxx_global_var_init()`. Calling `LOCK()` within constructor (of a object in global scope) is problematic (at least on OSX).

events.message:
fix locking issue with new mempool limiting

Current master crashes on OSX with an exception: "boost: mutex lock failed in pthread_mutex_lock: Invalid argument"

events.body: The issue that this PR solves was introduced in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6722

issue.title: Turn the global mempool into a shared pointer
issue.body:
Global mempool is defined here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/8237889e8d0fb7542669a9098516c96da91913f0/src/validation.cpp#L130

It should be changed to a shared pointer (and renamed `g_mempool`) so that it isn't initialized until runtime. That would allow us to remove the code added in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6889.

issue.title: [Core] MemPool package tracking and limits
issue.body:
built on top of
- [x] #1645 

This PR pulls some updates from upstream in the mempool area, adding the required adjustments for legacy zerocoin txes and updating the functional test suite.

Specifically, here we:
- track mempool descendants (in-mempool transactions that depend on other mempool transactions)
- turn `mapTx` into a `boost::multi_index_container` that sorts the mempool on 3 criteria:
  - transaction hash
  - fee rate
  - time in the mempool
- Add a max size for the mempool (throwing away the cheapest txs and bumping the min relay fee, when full)
- Implement on-the-fly mempool size limit with the flag `-maxmempool`
- Implement `-checkmempool=N` to customize the frequency of the mempool check
- Implement helper for `CTxMemPoolEntry` for the unit tests.

Backports:

- bitcoin/bitcoin#6654
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6722 [`*`] 
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6889
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6771
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6776
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6896
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7020

[`*`] excluding https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6722/commits/9e93640be6c49fa1505ba5c5df8c89210da5a6e4 as our default minimum tx fee rate of 10k satoshis is only 0,00003 USD at the time of writing.

issue.title: Mutex lock failure results in crash on exit on native macOS or in debug mode
issue.body:
Latest master.

Reproducibility: always

Introduced in the latest commits.

```
Process 53528 launched: '/Users/rex/zcash/src/zcashd' (x86_64)

% zcash-cli stop

libc++abi: terminating with uncaught exception of type boost::wrapexcept<boost::lock_error>: boost: mutex lock failed in pthread_mutex_lock: Invalid argument
Process 53528 stopped
* thread #1, name = 'zcash-shutoff', queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = breakpoint 10.4
    frame #0: 0x00007fff20671399 libsystem_c.dylib`abort
libsystem_c.dylib`abort:
->  0x7fff20671399 <+0>: pushq  %rbp
    0x7fff2067139a <+1>: movq   %rsp, %rbp
    0x7fff2067139d <+4>: pushq  %r14
    0x7fff2067139f <+6>: pushq  %rbx
Target 0: (zcashd) stopped.
(lldb) bt
* thread #1, name = 'zcash-shutoff', queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = breakpoint 10.4
  * frame #0: 0x00007fff20671399 libsystem_c.dylib`abort
    frame #1: 0x00007fff206dfef2 libc++abi.dylib`abort_message + 241
    frame #2: 0x00007fff206d15e5 libc++abi.dylib`demangling_terminate_handler() + 242
    frame #3: 0x00007fff205ca595 libobjc.A.dylib`_objc_terminate() + 104
    frame #4: 0x00007fff206df307 libc++abi.dylib`std::__terminate(void (*)()) + 8
    frame #5: 0x00007fff206df2a9 libc++abi.dylib`std::terminate() + 41
    frame #6: 0x00000001000030af zcashd`__clang_call_terminate + 15
    frame #7: 0x0000000100410b47 zcashd`CNetCleanup::~CNetCleanup(this=0x0000000101629470) at net.cpp:2014:13
    frame #8: 0x00000001003c82f3 zcashd`CNetCleanup::~CNetCleanup(this=0x0000000101629470) at net.cpp:2011:5
    frame #9: 0x00007fff2064bd35 libsystem_c.dylib`__cxa_finalize_ranges + 316
    frame #10: 0x00007fff2064c020 libsystem_c.dylib`exit + 53
    frame #11: 0x00007fff20737f44 libdyld.dylib`start + 8
```

issue.title: ZIP 239 preparations 1
issue.body:
This is the first of several backports to prepare for ZIP 239. The primary
change is altering `mapRelay` to store `CTransaction`s, which we need
because ZIP 239 requires changing `Inv` messages based on transaction
versions. The other changes are mainly for conflict removal but are also
independently useful.

Backports the following upstream PRs:
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6889
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7125
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7862
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7877

labels.name: C-upstream-port
labels.description: Category: Changes that are ported from the Bitcoin Core codebase.

comments.body:
Usually projects have some convention for this (eg _XX and XX, or XX_nolock and XX) . Where one is used internally (when lock already held) and the other externally (locks and calls inner function). 
Preferable to have the names as similar as possible with just the lock/nonlock difference. `lockAndClear` and `clearSync` are too far apart to be easily recognizable as a set. So IMO the current naming is better.
:+1: just not something I'd seen before.
